intro: Schwartzkopffia angolensis, commonly known as the Angolan star grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its tufted, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
